meanings.definition: Easily made to feel sick or disgusted
meanings.sent1: Her squeamishness towards bugs made her avoid camping trips.
meanings.sent2: His squeamishness about horror movies meant he always closed his eyes during the scary parts.
meanings.sent3: The squeamishness of the cat towards the new food was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The squeamishness of the detective towards the crime scene was evident in his hesitant steps.
meanings.sent5: The squeamishness of the child towards vegetables was so strong that he refused to even look at them.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nausea or disgust, especially at the sight of blood
meanings.sent1: The nurse's squeamishness at the sight of blood made it difficult for her to assist in surgeries.
meanings.sent2: His squeamishness over blood made him turn away from the gory scene in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The squeamishness of the vampire towards garlic was quite amusing to his human friends.
meanings.sent4: Her squeamishness towards blood was like a barrier between her and the medical profession.
meanings.sent5: The squeamishness of the crowd at the sight of the accident was palpable in the air.
